posts.post_content:
I am trying to acquire 1 card for each person in the Hall of Fame (if possible). I have broken down the members by era (Pre-War, Post War, Modern), and have different requirements for each era. 

Pre War: Any playing days card.
Post War: Their last card.
Modern: Their rookie card.

I am not looking to complete this project in one post, but want to see what's available and buy a little here and a little there. Additionally, I was going through my binder and need 15 T206s for 3 complete binder pages. I have some commons I'll eventually target, but want to knock out the backs I need first.

The following are a list of players/backs I currently need from the T206 set. The backs can be paired with any player in the T206 set, and the HoFers can be paired with any T206 back. I am looking for lower grade examples, with minimal to no paper loss, no writing/marks (stamps, especially date, might be ok), but creasing/wear is ok. I prefer the HoFers to be graded by SGC, but would consider other companies (raw is least preferred for the HoFers). 

Backs

[STRIKE]Old Mill[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Old Mill SL[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Cycle 350[/STRIKE]
Sovereign 350 Apple Green
American Beauty 350 w/ Frame
EPDG
Sweet Caporal 350-460 Fact. 25
Cycle 460
[STRIKE]Sovereign 460[/STRIKE]
American Beauty 350 No Frame

HoFers

George Davis (T206)

[STRIKE]Eddie Collins (T206)[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Tris Speaker (T206)[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Cy Young (T206)[/STRIKE]
Walter Johnton (T206)
[STRIKE]Christy Mathewson (T206)[/STRIKE]


Please PM or email me at [url]kmayusa6060@gmail.com[/url]

Eddie Collins: Check. Thanks Tony!

What else do y'all have for me?

Knocked out a big one - Cy Young. Thanks Scott! Fun, fun. :rolleyes:

Let's keep going shall we?

Really enjoying the progress I've made on this project since posting this last week. Thank you to those that have messaged me and/or made deals with me. 

Let's keep it going!
I've knocked out a good amount so far. Let's keep it going! Christmas will be here before you know it, and I'd like to help you get the perfect gift for that special someone. Help me help you. ;)

Have knocked out quite a bit (down to just 15 T206 HoFers for this project!), and would have more knocked out if it weren't for moving some stuff for surprise bigger purchases. Thank you to everyone I've dealt with so far!

I have a few things to move to recoup some costs, but it still never hurts to look! Also, let me help you fund that gift for someone special this Christmas season... ^ ;)
